physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady. She is seated on an ornate armchair with intricate floral designs on the backrest. She is dressed in her ethnic costume. There is a vase beside her and she is holding a book in her hands.
sgcool_label_text:
This carte de visite shows a nyonya in a sarong kebaya seated on an ornate chair next to a large vase. This photograph was probably taken by John Thomson. 

John Thomson (1837 â€“ 1921) was a pioneering Scottish photographer and one of the first to travel to Asia. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
subject_terms_1: black-and-white photographs studio portraits Peranakan folk costume women (female humans)
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Peranakan (Asian people) Ethnic costume Women
